means: 使凝聚成一团或形成一堆

word_mean: 成批，大量，整体，大容量，体积

sentence.Network_en: Sloping walls on the bulk of the building create an optical illusion.
sentence.Network_cn: 大楼主体的斜墙给人造成一种视错觉。

sentence.Network_en: Despite his bulk he moved lightly on his feet.
sentence.Network_cn: 尽管他身形庞大，移动起来还是很灵巧。

sentence.Network_en: Shopkeepers buy them in bulk and resell them for £150 each.
sentence.Network_cn: 店主们先大量购进，然后再以150英镑的单价将它们转卖出去。

jx.jx_en_mean: In large numbers, amounts, or volume.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 大批，大量：数量、数目或体积很大

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English : the senses 'cargo as a whole' and 'heap, large quantity' (the earliest recorded) are probably from Old Norse búlki 'cargo'; other senses arose perhaps by alteration of obsolete bouk 'belly, body'

entry.def: You can refer to something's bulk when you want to emphasize that it is very large.

example.ex: The truck pulled out of the lot, its bulk unnerving against the dawn.
example.tran: 卡车从空地上开出来，庞大的车身小心翼翼地避让着草坪。

example.ex: ...the shadowy bulk of an ancient barn.
example.tran: 一座古老谷仓的巨大阴影

entry.tran: 庞大的身躯；巨大的体重；肥硕的体形
entry.def: You can refer to a large person's body or to their weight or size as their bulk .

example.ex: Bannol lowered his bulk carefully into the chair...
example.tran: 班诺尔小心翼翼地将肥硕的身躯落座到椅子上。

example.ex: Despite his bulk he moved lightly on his feet.
example.tran: 尽管他身形庞大，移动起来还是很灵巧。

entry.def: The bulk of something is most of it.

example.ex: The bulk of the text is essentially a review of these original documents...
example.tran: 文章的主要部分基本是对这些原始文件的回顾。

example.ex: The vast bulk of imports and exports are carried by sea.
example.tran: 大部分的进出口货物都是通过海路运输的。

entry.def: If you buy or sell something in bulk, you buy or sell it in large quantities.

example.ex: Buying in bulk is more economical than shopping for small quantities.
example.tran: 批量采购要比零买实惠很多。

means.word_mean: 1. the property resulting from being or relating to the greater in number of two parts; the main part;

sentences.sentence: "the majority of his customers prefer it"
"the bulk of the work is finished"

means.word_mean: 2. the property of something that is great in magnitude;

sentences.sentence: "it is cheaper to buy it in bulk"

means.word_mean: 3. the property possessed by a large mass
2. cause to bulge or swell outwards

auth_sentence.content: He is not trusted by the bulk of Egyptians.
auth_sentence.res_content: He is not trusted by the bulk of Egyptians.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He is not trusted by the bulk of Egyptians.

auth_sentence.content: The bulk of the samples came from pregnant women.
auth_sentence.res_content: The bulk of the samples came from pregnant women.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The bulk of the samples came from pregnant women.

auth_sentence.content: She's the one doing the bulk of the work.
auth_sentence.res_content: She's the one doing the bulk of the work.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: She's the one doing the bulk of the work.

Sentence.sentence: Some businesses will benefit but the vast bulk of the savings will be captured by workers, not their employers.
He also said that he could not discuss discounts to universities for bulk purchases.

sentences.en: Great bulk does not always mean great weight.
sentences.cn: 体积大并不总是意味着份量重。

sentences.en: They added extra pages to bulk a book out.
sentences.cn: 他们增加额外页数使书更厚。

means.word_mean: 显得巨大(或庞大、笨重)，显得重要；变得越来越大，变得越来越重要；庞然出现；呈现

sentences.en: The case bulked large in the lawyer's thoughts.
sentences.cn: 这案子在律师看来很重要。

jushi.english: Great bulk does not always mean great weight.
jushi.chinese: 体积大并不总是意味着分量重。

jushi.english: The elephant lowered its great bulk.
jushi.chinese: 大象蹲下了它那庞大的身躯。

jushi.english: The baby needs more bulk in his diet.
jushi.chinese: 这个婴儿的饮食中需要添点儿纤维素。
